subject_terms_3: East India Company  Trade and Industry
physical_appearance: "This is a coranto reporting on events in the East Indies. Its cover is largely red, but has a dark brown spine, along which the words ""A Courante of Newes from the East India 1622"" is imprinted. "
sgcool_label_text: This coranto is possibly the earliest surviving broadshaeet reporting on events in the East Indies. Written to the British East India Company, it reports on the Dutch East India Company's capture of the Banda islands of Lantore (Great Banda) and Polaroone (Pulo Run) from the British in 1621. The report focused on the purported sacking and violence commited by the Dutch, and the forcible removal of the Banda inhabitants to Batavia.
title_text: A Courante of Newes from the East India "1622 English Coranto Titled ""A Courante of Newes from the East India"""
subject_terms_2: Broadsides  East India Company  East Indies  Banda Islands (Indonesia)  British  Reports Netherlands  Spice trade
